modules.title: I'm Brand New! What Do I Do?
modules.description: If you're brand new to Isidore, or just need a complete refresher, pop into any of the lessons below to learn the fundamentals. The topics covered include background information about Isidore, basic navigation and layout of the system and the site creation process.

lessons.title: What Is Isidore?

videos.title: What Is Isidore, And What Does It Do?

lessons.overviewcontent: Isidore is UD's open-source Learning Management System or LMS. Isidore is based on the Sakai LMS, but why did UD go this direction? Find out in this lesson.
lessons.section1content: Watch this 2 minute video for an introduction to Isidore.
lessons.section2content: Now it's time to prove you watched the video. Complete the Quick Quiz below and earn a badge.

references.title: Wiki Page for St. Isidore of Seville
Why Open Source? - Written by eLearning Staff

aside2questions.question: So Isidore is open-source. What features have you built?
aside2questions.answer: The Attendance tool, Tsugi learning apps, the Checklist tool, and this very training platform! We share these features with the broader open-source community so they are used worldwide. If you want to see all of our work, check out our Isidore Releases page: https://ewiki.udayton.edu/isidore/Isidore_releases.

aside2questions.question: I have a feature request! How do I let you know?
aside2questions.answer: Just call or email the Office of eLearning! We are available at 937-229-5039 and elearning@udayton.edu. We'll make a ticket for you, then we'll be sure to let you know when the feature is added to Isidore.

aside2questions.question: Why is Arnold Schwarzeneggar in your video?
aside2questions.answer: In his feature role as John Kimble in Kindergarten Cop, Arnold transforms from a one-dimensional, gruff police officer into a passionate teaher dedicated to learning. We feel this character is a perfect introduction to our learning management system (but mostly we just really like the movie).

lessons.aside3content: St. Isidore of Seville sought to compile all knowledge into an encyclopedia known as 'Etymologiae.' In the 20 books composing the encylopedia, St. Isidore covers math, music, law, languages, atoms, elements, agriculture, metals, animals, and more. You can find ALL these topics covered within the Isidore LMS. UD is carrying on Isidore's legacy!

aside2questions.question: I don't have a UD account yet. How can I log in?
aside2questions.answer: Please contact the IT Service Center to obtain your credentials. You can reach them at itservicecenter@udayton.edu or at 937-229-3888. If your credentials are 'in-the-works', contact eLearning to obtain 'guest' logins.

aside2questions.question: What browsers work best with Isidore?
aside2questions.answer: We recommend Chrome and Firefox, though Edge and Safari are also supported.

aside2questions.question: Why is 2-factor authentication needed?
aside2questions.answer: As a part of the campus community, you play a part in keeping our campus safe - this includes from cyber attacks. Your password is the easiest way for attacks on our systems to happen, so the additional step of approving log ins on a secondary device is a critical step for safety.

modules.title: Isidore 101
modules.description: These lessons cover the basics of the most commonly (and easily) used tools.

lessons.title: Announcements Basics
lessons.overviewcontent: Use the Announcements tool to post messages for your students. You may attach document and add links. By default, Announcements are also sent to students’ emails, so you can be sure they see the message.
lessons.section1content: Watch this 1 minute video to see how to get started with the Announcements tool.
lessons.section2content: It's now time for you to try posting your own Announcement.
lessons.section2prereq: To complete this step, you must first create a test site as instructed in the Creating Course Sites lesson..
lessons.section3content: Now that you've practiced posting an Announcement . . .

references.title: When you communicate with students, tone matters

aside2questions.question: Where do students see Announcements?
aside2questions.answer: Students have the option to see Announcements in multiple locations. By default, they can see links to all of their Announcements on their Isidore homepage. They would also see the links to the Announcements on your course site homepage. If you didn’t change the default behavior, students would receive an email notification including the text of the announcement.

aside2questions.question: Do Announcements work if the site is unpublished?
aside2questions.answer: Not really. The Announcement will be posted, but an email will not be delivered to students’ inboxes, and they would have no way of seeing the Announcement until the site is published.

aside2questions.question: Will I receive an email notification about the Announcement as the instructor?
aside2questions.answer: Yes. Other instructors in your site, if any,  will also receive the email notification.

aside2questions.question: Can I schedule Announcements?
aside2questions.answer: You bet! Just choose the 'Specify Dates' option after writing the text for your Announcement. Pick the dates the Announcement should be visible, and it will appear (and disappear) on the selected dates.

aside2questions.question: Can I save an Announcement as a draft?
aside2questions.answer: Definitely. Choose the 'Hide' option after writing your Announcement, then press the Post Announcement button. It will be hidden until you edit the Announcement and change that setting to Show.

aside2questions.question: Can I delete an Announcement?
aside2questions.answer: Yes - but you cannot delete the email notification from students' inboxes once sent, so proofread before you post!

lessons.aside3content: 432,000 Announcements have been posted in Isidore since 2008. Y'all do a lot of announcing.
